Articles.Title: A Star is born of African - Irish descent

Images.Caption: Barbados is an island country in the eastern Caribbean Islands.
Images.Narration: On the 20th of February 1988, a hazel eyed, mixed race girl was born in the outskirts of Bridgetown in Barbados.

Images.Caption: Barbados is roughly 7 times the area of Manhattan, with a population of about 287,000. It's capital and largest city is Bridgetown.
Images.Narration: Barbados is a developed and peaceful country with a very high quality of life. It's population is predominantly of African descent.

Images.Caption: As many as 50,000 Irish people were unwillingly transported to Barbados during the 1650s.
Images.Narration: Barbados was a colony of the English Crown and around the 17th century a large number of white Irish people were involuntarily transported to Barbados, to work in sugar plantations.

Images.Caption: Rihanna's green eyes and skin complexion are a testament to her Irish roots.
Images.Narration: The ¬†Irish of Barbados, who came to be known as Red legs, began to inter-marry with alluring Barbadians and the product of one such union was Ronald Fenty, Rihanna's father.
Robyn Rihanna Fenty was born and raised in the parish of Saint Michael¬†on the Caribbean island of Barbados. She is the eldest of three siblings. The daughter of Monica and Ronald Fenty.

Images.Caption: Rihanna at 10 years old.
Images.Narration:
Her childhood was a difficult one, marred by constant arguments between her parents and their eventual divorce. Her father was an alcoholic addicted to cocaine who has since then overcome his addictions.
She loved music from a young age. She began singing when she was seven, and went on to form a musical trio with her classmates as a high school student.

Images.Caption: Some people say that a girl turns sweet at 16 and they‚Äôre not wrong üòç
Rihanna has two younger brothers, Rorrey and Rajad.
Images.Narration: In a shockingly candid interview with the Mirror in 2007, Rihanna opened up about her father's drug addiction. Rihanna said, "Even as a toddler, I learned that my mum and dad would argue when there was foil paper in the ashtray.

Images.Caption: The entire family watched their father, Ronald Fenty, struggle with drug addiction.
Rihanna said that her father used to beat her mother and Rihanna often got involved in attempts to "break up a fight."
Images.Narration: But I think every child growing up goes through some sort of upheaval and perhaps mine was a bit worse. At the end of the day, I don't think about it anymore and it doesn't make me angry.

Images.Caption: Rihanna's father, Ronald Fenty with his ex-wife and Rihanna's mother, Monica Braithwaite.
Images.Narration: Rihanna's mother Monica eventually divorced Ronald, and Rihanna looked after her two younger brothers so that her mother could work to support them.

Images.Caption: After Chris Brown assaulted Rihanna, Ronald Fenty shocked his daughter by selling news of the incident to the press.
Images.Narration: Rihanna said, "Domestic violence is not somebody that people want anybody to know, so she would just hide it in the house. I always said to myself, 'I'm never going to date somebody like my dad, never.

Images.Caption: What Rihanna Did For Her Dad After His Coronavirus Diagnosis.
Images.Narration:
Ronald Fenty, was diagnosed with coronavirus April 2020. In an interview he said, "I feared the worst. I thought I was going to die, honestly." 


Luckily for Fenty's sake, Rihanna was able to step in and provide him with the help he needed.

 He was able to pull through after Rihanna, who had been "checking in" on him "every day," shipped him a ventilator

Images.Caption: As for Rihanna, her foundation donated¬†$5 million to various organizations assisting with coronavirus relief efforts.
Now that Fenty is doing better, he's committed to spreading awareness about the virus.
¬†"I want everybody to stay home," he said. "This is a serious situation. More serious than people realize. Please stay home.
Images.Narration: "I have to say, I love you so much,'" he told Rihanna.¬†"She did so much for me. I appreciate everything she has done."
